intro: Phyllanthus gossweileri, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, green, fleshy leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or along riverbanks. Phyllanthus gossweileri is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
